intro: Triclisia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola trichodesmid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Triclisia angolensis is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry conditions.
